contentrichtext.text: {{One source|date=November 2007}} '''Sir Michael David Kadoorie, [[Gold Bauhinia Star|GBS]]''' (born 1941, [[Hong Kong]]) is a business executive and philanthropist. As of March 2011, he is the 6th wealthiest person in Hong Kong, with the wealth of his family estimated to be 6.1 billion [[US dollars]] according to Forbes' annual [[List of billionaires (2007)|list of billionaires]].<ref>[http://www.forbes.com/profile/michael-kadoorie Michael Kadoorie & family - Forbes.com]</ref> The son of business tycoon [[Lord Kadoorie|Lawrence Kadoorie]] (1899–1993) and his wife, Muriel Gubbay, Michael Kadoorie was educated at [[Kowloon Junior School]] in [[Hong Kong]] as well as [[Institut Le Rosey]] in [[Switzerland]]. His family’s roots in business in the Far East go back to his grandfather, a descendant of [[Iraq]]i Jews originally from [[Baghdad]], who first settled in Shanghai in 1880. After a spell in Bombay, India, his grandfather made a fortune in Shanghai, mostly lost in 1949, and later, in Hong Kong through finance, real estate and utilities. Headquartered in Hong Kong soon after 1949, Kadoorie's father and uncle successfully expanded the family businesses into a diversified group, led by the company flagship [[China Light and Power|CLP Holdings Ltd.]] Kadoorie is the Chairman of [[China Light and Power|CLP Holdings Ltd.]] which his family founded in 1890 and in which they still hold a 35% stake. The utility company provides electricity to 75% of Hong Kong as sole operator (licensed through a Scheme of Control) in Kowloon and the New Territories, and has equity interests in power plants in [[China]], [[Southeast Asia]], [[Australia]] and [[India]]. He is also the Chairman of the family's second largest listed group, The Hong Kong and Shanghai Hotels, owners and operators of the world-renowned [[The Peninsula Hong Kong|Peninsula Hotel Group]]. He controls and is a director of [[Metrojet Ltd.]] Heliservices (Hong Kong) Limited and has initiated CLP Research Institute (a subsidiary of CLP Holdings which looks into renewable energy development). He holds a number of directorships in other non-Kadoorie companies. He was a member of the Council of the [[University of Hong Kong]] and, in 2000, the Kadoorie Biological Sciences Building opened at the university.{{citation needed|date=November 2009}} ==Awards== A trustee of the Kadoorie Charitable Foundation, Michael Kadoorie was made an Officer of the [[Legion of Honor]] by the government of [[France]] and a Commander of the [[Order of Léopold II]] of [[Belgium]]. He was also awarded a knighthood, as a [[Knight Bachelor]], in the Queen's Birthday Honours List on 11 June 2005. In 2004, the [[University of Hong Kong]] awarded him an honorary LLD. {{citation needed|date=November 2009}} ==Personal life== A photography buff, Kadoorie is also a helicopter pilot and a fan of classic cars. He is the owner of a number of rare automobiles including a [[Bugatti Type 57]], a 1932 [[Rolls-Royce Phantom II]] Thrupp & Maberly, a 1934 [[Hispano-Suiza]] J12 Van Vooren Cabriolet, a 1969 [[Lamborghini Miura]] P400 S, a 1924 [[Vauxhall Prince Henry|Vauxhall 30-98]] Tourer and a [[Rolls-Royce Silver Ghost]].{{citation needed|date=May 2013}} In 1998, he spent two months recovering from serious injuries at the John Radcliffe Hospital in [[Oxford, England]] after having an accident in his vintage [[Ferrari]] when the spokes in two of the rebuilt wheels tore through the tyres. ==Family== He lives in Hong Kong with his wife, Lady Betty; they have three children. ==See also== *[[Kadoorie family]] *[[List of billionaires]] ==References== <references/> {{s-start}} {{s-prec}} {{s-bef|before = [[Lo Ka-shui]]<br><small>''Recipients of the Gold Bauhinia Star''</small>}} {{s-ttl|title = [[Hong Kong order of precedence]]<br><small>''Recipients of the Gold Bauhinia Star''</small>}} {{s-aft|after = [[Yuan Geng]]<br><small>''Recipients of the Gold Bauhinia Star''</small>}} {{s-end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Kadoorie, Michael David | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Hong Kong entrepreneur and philanthropist | DATE OF BIRTH = 1941 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kadoorie, Michael}} [[Category:1941 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alumni of Institut Le Rosey]] [[Category:Hong Kong entrepreneurs]] [[Category:Hong Kong philanthropists]] [[Category:Hong Kong Jews]] [[Category:Iraqi Jews]] [[Category:Kadoorie family]] [[Category:People from Baghdad]] [[Category:Hong Kong billionaires]] [[Category:Jewish philanthropists]] [[Category:Officiers of the Légion d'honneur]] [[Category:Commanders of the Order of Leopold II]] [[Category:Recipients of the Gold Bauhinia Star]] [[Category:Knights Bachelor]] [[Category:Mizrahi Jews]]
